JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Create and execute test cases for assigned feature(s)Plan and write manual test cases while Dev Team begins coding work.Conduct testing as code is completed and merged to testing environment.Report any bugsRetest until all test cases are passing as expectedConduct necessary regression testingEvaluate and update test run resultsKeep manual test cases up to date as things inevitably change.Update/retire any manual test cases that have been become obsoleteCommunicate issues, risks and test status in a timely and detailed mannerAbility to troubleshoot software defects and identify root causePerforming manual QAEffectively collaborate with team members to achieve the best resultsAssist in creating and maintaining documentationPart of Agile team consists of DEV & QA which is responsible for the upcoming releasesExpand the QA capabilities, quality and efficiencyEvaluate business requirement and technical specification documents to craft test strategies and Level of Effort (LOE) assessments which would account for, durations, constraints, assumptions, etc. that are needed to fulfill test objectives
JOB CONTEXT: The role of the Quality Analyst is to assist the software development team to deliver high quality software development tools on time.Must have good Interest to learn System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Software Quality Assurance. The Quality Analyst assists with testing for software changes and/or new releases along with writing test cases, documenting test procedures, documenting test results, maintaining valid test data which would include valid test scenarios to ensure the quality of products.This role requires an inquisitive, proactive mind and a genuine interest in technology and/or online applications in general. As a Quality Analyst at CSL, your task is assisting in testing the software products, develop the experience and know-how to create and execute test cases for software, as well as experience working on software development teams.This role takes direction from Senior QA and/ or Lead QA.
ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
Age 25 to 32 years 
MS Office experience, including Project, Excel, PowerPoint and Word (preferred)Familiarity with software development and web/mobile application testing concepts (preferred)Ability to analyze and test software applications at an end-user levelAttention to detail, excellent communication skillsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment that requires frequent shift in areas of focusAbility to work independently and take initiative to solve problems and QA challengesExecute assigned tasks in harmony with the test scheduleInterest in SQA methodologies and practices
